literalTranslation: If one starts thinking of the atrocities committed by the rat he may be tempted to burn down his own house in anger
meaning: Don't take other people's ill deeds to heart
text: Onye Kworo ihe oke na eme osuo ụlọ ọkụ

literalTranslation: I will not bother telling an old woman to blow her nose. Because I would not have to eat her head when she dies
meaning: Mind your business
text: Agaghị m agwa agadi nwanyị zie imi makana ọbụghịm ga ata isi ya ma ọ nwụọ

literalTranslation: The dog said instead of being idle he would rather busy himself with licking his balls
text: Nkịta sịrị kama ịnọ nkịtị ya arachawa mkpụrụ amụ ya

literalTranslation: The housefly said it cannot stop perching on wounds just because his kinsmen are dying off suddenly
text: Ijiji sịrị na ya agaghị eji maka ọnwụ ike na egbu ụmụnna ya nwee hapụ ị́bè n'ọnya

literalTranslation: A woman does not know the value of a husband until when he dies
meaning: People don't know the value of a thing until the thing is no more
text: Nwanyi anaghị ama uru dị bara ruokwa mgbe ọ ghọrọ ajadụ

literalTranslation: The animal that climbs using its teeth knows the bitter trees
meaning: Experience gives insight
text: Makana anụ ji eze arị elu maara osisi na eli ilu

literalTranslation: The elder who says he does not know how to dig the earth is a mischievous elder
text: Okenye sịrị na ya amaghị egwu ala, wụ okenye arụrụ ala

literalTranslation: Does one pursue the tortoise with great speed? Is it going to fly?
text: Ana achụ mbekwu n'ị́ké, ọ ga èfé elu?

literalTranslation: It is a stone the size of an elephant that you throw at an elephant
meaning: Big problems require big approach
text: Ọ bụ íché ha ka ényí ka ana ama enyi
Ntukwu nwanyi adịghị mma na ala ata
Onye amụ ibi rigoro n'elu nkwụ, obele adị anọ
Ana agwa ayari okwu ọna ekwe n'isi, amaghị ka o kwere ekwe ka ọ jụrụ ajụ

literalTranslation: The favour a man does for his fellow man is like giving someone something to keep for you
meaning: One good turn deserves another
text: Ihe nwoke meere ibe ya bụ ngaa jiderem

literalTranslation: A woman at the diviner's shrine mistakenly farted. The diviner asked her what was the matter? And she replied that the farting was part of the problems that made her visit
text: Nwanyị ana agbara áfā ka ahụ pụnarịrị nwadibia ajụọ ya ọgịnị, ọsị na ọbụ ha ncha ka oji maka ya bia
Ọnụ ihe mere ede ji bee wịị

literalTranslation: A blind man was told that his inlaw has come, and he responds that it has been a long time he set his eyes on the said inlaw
text: Onyeìsì ka agwara na ọgọ ya abiaghi, ọ sị na otego ya hụrụ ya
Onye na eri ihe onye ọrịa ọcha na akpụ ya ị́sị́
Abọọ mgbada mgbe egburu ya, olu agaghị eho ya

literalTranslation: When the glutton eats the chameleon, he would stop eating meat
text: Ụsakụsa rie ogwumagana ọ kwụsị iri anụ
meaning: When one's bad habit lands him into unpleasant circumstances, he rapidly changes his ways

text: Monkey sịrị na áhà ya bụ Michael na ọbụ ndị mkpọrọmasi na akpọ ya monkey

literalTranslation: If a child eats a food meant for elders, the spirits take notice of him (in a bad way)
text: Nwata rie nri okenye, ndị mmụọ ahụwa ya ama
meaning: Grave actions attract bad publicity

literalTranslation: The monkey can so jump is because the trees are close together
text: Enwe ana amaka bụ na osisi didebere

literalTranslation: Mountain race is nothing new to the antelope
text: Ọsọ ugwu abụghị ihe ọhụrụ na ebe mgbada nọ
meaning: Difficult feats are easy to the skilled man. Practice makes difficult things easy

text: Akwụnye anụ n'ọkụ, nwata ejee ozi esibeghị ya ezi
literalTranslation: When they place a piece of meat on the fire, a child goes on an errand he has not yet been sent
meaning: People become do their best when they forsee a future reward

text: Edebeghi n'elu ụlọ maka oké, edebeghi na-ala maka ewu keduzi ebe aga edebezi
literalTranslation: Can't keep on a high place because of the rat. Can't keep on the ground because of the goat. Where would one now keep (foodstuff)?
meaning: Life is full of challenges. You can't avoid risks in life

text: Oke ji ọsọ na n'ọnụ agwọ bụ azụ ka ọga eji apụta
literalTranslation: The rat which runs into a snake's hole with speed, would have to come out with backsteps (without turning)
meaning: When you rush into a bad situation without forethought, you would then have to apply great care to get yourself out of it

text: Nkịta nyara akpa nsi agwụ na ọhịa
literalTranslation: When the dog carries a bad, the forest would be rid of excreta
meaning: A good tool in the hand of a passionate/skillful person would only increase his efficiency

text: Onye nna ya dara ibi ihe ukwu adịghịzị atụ ya egwu
literalTranslation: The person whose father suffers an enlarged scrotum is no longer afraid of big things
meaning: Tough situations make us tougher

text: Ofeke mụta ịta atụ osisi dị na ọhịa agwụ
literalTranslation: When the foolish learns how to use the chewing stick, he breaks every twig in the forest
meaning: Too much of anything is bad

text: Emee onye ara conductor, ofegbuo onwe ya n'aka
literalTranslation: When you make a mad man a conductor, he flings his hands to excess
meaning: It is only a foolish person that does things to excess

text: Ọnụ mpio gbaa ngọ nkịta achara aba
Ọbụ ose ka-eji ata anụ rere ure
Asogide onye anya, ekpuru nkata n'ihu gwa ya okwu
literalTranslation: When a king is dreaded for too long, someone would wear a basket over his face and talk to the king
meaning: The truth must be told, even if it means disguising the message to avoid self harm

text: Ana ekwu na akpa ezighị ndị dibia ofeke ayara abụọ na akpagharị
literalTranslation: While it is being said that bags are not enough for the native doctors, a foolish person is sighted walking about with 2 bags
meaning: People who need something may lack it. While a clueless person has such coveted thing in excess

text: Oke gwara ibi ya awakwana anya, na orughi ka ihe oji eze atawa
Ọbughi ihe niile na atọ nwanyị ụtọ na atọ ya amụ
Onye ara gwara onye ibi na ọchọọ ka akụwasịwa akụwasịwa
Ana agwa onye ibi ya amana aja, ọkwa ọmachaa ihe ọhụrụ o nwere
literalTranslation: Do you have to tell the man with an enlarged scrotum not to scale a fence? After he is done, he would realize what he has done to himself
meaning: The obstinate is bound to learn from bad experience

text: Maamiri bụ ... Mana onweghịzị ebe aga esi jide ya aka
Amụ kelibe ọdị ka ọga agbawa ikpu
Ọ bụghị ebe aka ewu zọrọ ka ụkwụ ya na azọ
literalTranslation: A walking goat's fore and hindlimbs do not step on the same spots
meaning: Don't force followers/children/wards to behave exactly like yourself.

text: Ọbụ oke ịgba ajị n'ị́kè na ebulata nsị n'ụlọ
literalTranslation: Excessive anal hair is what brings home faeces (from the bush where one went to defecate)
meaning: Too much of anything is bad

text: Ọọ kwa uche ka eji agba adaka
literalTranslation: He who is shooting at a baboon has to be smart
meaning: It takes smartness to deal with an equally smart person

text: Mgbada yia ka ényí ike awara ya
Agaghị ejikwa na ịsị ọkụkọ epeka nwere sị na nya na ewu bụ ọgbọ
Ọkụkọ mmanya na egbu hụ égbé ara na agba isi ajụọ ya oyi
literalTranslation: When a drunk fowl meets a crazy kite, he calmly calms down
meaning: Every obstinate person has someone or something he fears and respects

text: Tụpụrụ nkịta ọkpụkpụ n'ezi hapụziere ya ọgụ ya na ndi mmụọ
literalTranslation: Throw out the bone to the dog, and forget about how he is going to wrestle with the spirits over it
meaning: Do your part and leave the rest. Don't withold a good deed because you think other people will not make the best of it

text: Ọtachara akị tufuo nkume, ocheere na akị agaghị agụzị ya ọzọ?
literalTranslation: He who throws away the stone after cracking kernels, does he think he would never get hungry again?
meaning: Don't kill the goose that lays the golden eggs

text: Ihe na esi nkakwụ isi dị ya na ọkpụkpụ
literalTranslation: The source of the skunk's pungent smell is in his bones
meaning: Used to imply that someone's bad behaviour is very unlikely to change

text: Ọgaranya jere mba anụ juru ala, bụ ndị ọna enye nyekwara ya
literalTranslation: The rich man who visits a land filled with animals (meat), is receiving a reward from those he has been benevolent to
meaning: Charity attracts favour

text: Atanị onye chọrọ ịja ya mma ya jaa ugbua anya ka doro ya. Makana égwú baa na nchịchịpụ anya onweghịzị onye ga ámá onye bụ onye
meaning: Help someone when he is still lowly, and he will appreciate it; favours done for an influential person are non recognizable

text: Onye chọọ ịma ọ́ya yara ènwè, ya ga lee atanị fụrụ ya ọkụ anya na anya ka ọhụ ka anya dị ya
literalTranslation: He who wants to know the severity of the illness suffered by the monkey, should go and look at the eyes of the atani that blew the warming fire for it
meaning: The magnitude of a problem is measured by the amount resources it took to solve it

text: Onye lewe anya na ...anya enwe jị dị na ọbá agwụ
E nwere ilu ilu bie okwu, ofeke agbara aka laa
literalTranslation: when discussions are concluded in proverbs, the good-for-nothing goes home empty handed

text: Esoro ụtọ ọgbọnọ arahụ n'ihu ukwu adọ
literalTranslation: Going by the sweetness of the ogbono, one may sleep under its tree
meaning: Too much of everything is bad. There is time for everything. Used to end gatherings which have been interesting and people don't feel like leaving

text: Anam emere onye isiukwu ebere? ọbụ mụ ga akwárá ya okpu
literalTranslation: Do I pity a bigheaded man? Am I the one to sew his cap?
meaning: Mind your business

text: Nwa olokpo sịrị na ihe ya ji ekpochi nsị ya aja bụ na ọnaghị ara ahụ ihe mmadụ aghọrọ nke onye ọzọ
Mgbe amụrụ dike na mba ka amụrụ ibe ya
Mgbe nne amụbeghị ọchịagha ọkwa ndị ọgụ na agarị
Ọkụ m jị hụnye jị kam ma, nke na agba achara na agụ ka mụ amaghị
Mbe na mbe gaa ahịa, uru anaghị adị ya
Nwa ọkụkọ gbaa olu nne ya ahapụ ya
Anya mmiri okenye na acha nzu nzu
Ahụghị nwoke na ubi, ayọọ nwanyị ji
Nwata hụkaria onyị nne ya, o gbuo ya mma ekwu
Ejide ibe ji na aka, asaa agụụ okwu
Nwanza sịrị sị gbawara ya afa ndụ, ma ọ bụrụ maka uto, onye ọbụla dị ndụ ga etoriri eto
Ọbụrụ na ọnwụ egbughị ji e jiri chụọ emechaa ọ ga epuriri ome
Ihe ọ masịrị ọkụkọ daa oké ọnụ ahịa, agaghị nwa nnụnụ achụ aja
Ebee ka egbugbere ọnụ jere mmiri ji ama eze
Mgbe ụtaba apụtebee o nwere onye azụzụ gburu
Ọna awụ ahụchaa ọnụ nnụnụ ajụwakwa kedụ ebe osi eri nri
Agụubi bee elu bee ala, anyị maara ólú diọkpa ọkụkọ
Achọwa ebe nwa mkpi si bịa ụwa agawa ikwu nne ya
Ngịga dị na ọkụ ma ọ bụghị nke anụ ọ bụrụ nke azụ
Ma ọ bụrụ na mmiri ebughi ogwe na uje ọga ebu ya na ụla
Akwa agbataobi na echu ụra
Si kelee onye nti chiri, ma elu anughi, ala ga anu
Onye ibi dinara ala, ọdika o dinara isi ghàrịịghà (ọdika o nweziri isi abụọ)
Ana asị agadi nwanyị mechie ụkwụ, ịma ebe osi eku ume
Adịghị ezo ezo agakwuru nwanyị ajadụ, makana amaara ebe di ya nọ
Atụọ anya nna ahụghị, ekee nwa ọkpọ
Oloro agụba na aṅụrị ọnụ, ọ nyụọla nsị
Agaghị eji makana na agụ na emeri enwe adị ụdara nwa enwe n'ụdị nke agụ
Ọbụ onye nzuzu rere mma ya tụrụ ọbọ
Ana akpụ arụ mere eme, nwa mkpi ana achụharị
Ejighi okwute elele isi kara aka
Ụkwa dara na ụbọchị oriri adaghị na oge
Ọ na aka mmá ka ọkụkọ nwere aka ya tụwaa akwa ya
Ana agwa nwata na ọ na egbu onwe ya, ọsị kedụ ọbara
Ihe onye bara nkịta ya ka ọ ga aza
Ihe eji etiri ibi mkpu bu na ebe ọ dị ajọka, ọ bụrụ ma, orughi ka ihe ana agwọ ajụ bụrụ n'isi
Akụ yie nwata egwu, ochee na ya abaala ọgaranya
Di na nwunye rijuo afọ lụwa ọgụ, ndị bu ọnụ aka ha mma
Adịghị akọọrọ akpịrị akọọrọ na ya na ụtara bụ nwanne
Ọbụ oke ịgba iche iche mere na agwọ enweghị ụmụnna
Ana esi na ihọ oke ama onye wụ okenye
Egbuo anụ nwanyị esighi eri, ńnú na ose akọọ ụkọ n'ụlọ
Ọbụrụ na ọkụkọ ekpee ọchịcha ikpe ikpe ga amarịrị ọchịcha
Udene sịrị na mmiri amaka ya na afọ a, na afọ ọzọ ọ ga arụta ụlọ?
Ogazi amaka mana ejighi ya ago mmuo
Udele buru anu oriri, onye isi ututu agaghi ahu ya. (If vultures had any value, even the early morning hunters won't be able to see it)
Anụ egburu egbu anaghị atụ obere mma egwu
Ọ dịrị isi mma ọ dịrị agụba
Asawa ikpere ụkwụ ka osi eji nji mmiri na ncha dị na ụlọ ga agwụ o
Ebutere dike oguna ụlọ ma ọlụghị, ọ bụrụ ụjọ
Ọkụkọ sịrị na ndị mmadụ kpọrọ ya asị, mere na ha hapụrụ akpana ya jee na ego ogiri na ahia
Ihe ana ahụghị na afọ nne ewi ekwesịghị ka ahụ ya na nke nwa ya
Egbe igwe gbakaria otu ebe, ọ dị ka ezitere ya ezite
Ọ bụrụ na onye isi asiwa gị na ọ ga akụwa gị isi I mara na o nwere okwute ọ zọdere ụkwụ
Onye oké tàrà arụ, gaa ya mbọ, ọ na echekwa ka ọ maa ya ụra
Emee elu mee ala, mbỌ tỌrỌ eze
Kam jee kam pụta na ama ọkwa nri
Ọkụkọ maara ka ike ya ha, ọsị sị kee ya ụdọ na ụkwụ
Nwata kpata akụ, okenye agagbuo onwe ya na ozi
Onye ajọ chi ka ahụhụ febara na imi. Ọ chọọ izipu ya nwee zipu mkpụrụ anya ya. Ọ chọọ ịtụtụ mkpụrụ anya ya nwee sojie aka na ala
Onye agwara bia buru ozu, ọsị na ya ebutubeghi ya mbụ. Ọ ga eji onye dị ndụ nwere mụọ
Ọyịm agwaram gị agwa bụ ezigbo ọyị. Akaaram agwa gị agwa bụ ajọ ọyị
Ejikwana maka ihe ọjọọ nwa mkpi mere gaa zọjie nwa agbọghọ ewu ụkwụ
Nwata jide ọkụ jide mma, ma ọkụ ereghị ya, mma eyie ya
Ọhụrụ nnukwu osimiri hapụ iti mkpu, ọ dị na azụ ụlọ nna ya
Awọ sịrị na ya nụrụ na onye na abịa be ya maara agbá mgba ofụma, o nwee makpuru ala chere ya
Ajọ nwanyị wèré ego ya zụta nri, agbataobi anụ olu ya
Nkịta sịrị nọọ mgbe ya na chi ya na akpa ihe dịịrị ha echee na ya nọ na ụra
Onye kwụrụ ọtọ emegharịgị ahụ, ngwere arịgoro ya elu
Ọbụ ike na ume ka eji afụ opi
Onye chaa ka ose, ya fụkwaa ka ose
Ọkụkọ nwa ogbenye bụ ehi ya
Ọ bụ mmiri na enyere ncha aka ka o nwee gbaa ụfụfụ
Ịchọrọdị ịma mana onye nụrụ ụzụ akwa ya na eti
Ejerem be mmụọ gụta ọkụ pụta na mmadụ ọ nyụnahụ m
Onye akpana agụ aka na ọdụ ma ọ dị ndụ ma ọ nwụrụ anwụ
Nsị agbaghị aka akpá ala ịhụ, ma ojighi ahụ, o jide maamịrị
Ejighi ugegbe ele ihe agba na aka
Ọgbaa ọsọ anaghị agbadebe ruo mgbe ihe na achụ ya chụdebere ya
Nwa nnụnụ na agba egwu na ezi, nwere ihe na akụrụ ya egwu na ime ọhịa
Asị onye oshi jide ọkụkọ, ọsị na ọna atụ ya egwu. Atụgharia ọ kpụrụ ehi
Onye buru chi ya ụzọ, ọ gbagbuo onwe ya na ọsọ
Anaghị asị ozu laa na akwa adịghị
Ọkpụkpụ na enweghị nkịta ata ka ọkụkọ sịrị sị wete ka ya walee
Ọ bụ oke nọ na ụlọ gwara oke nọ na ọhịa na azụ dị na ngịga
Ụdara bụ nke enwe. Anụ ndị ọzọ bịara nché
Ụsụ hụrụ ka eji mbazụ eli ibe ya, marakwa nọọ nka ụbọchị nke ya
Onye ara sịrị na ọbughi ara ya na agba na ewute ya, kama na ọbụ ngaharị di na ya
Ọkụkọ anaghị echefu onye foro ya ọdụ na ụdụmmiri
Onye mụ na ya na achụ anụ tụgharịrị si na ụkwụ mụ dịzịkwa ka nke anụ
Oji enyi nwee kwee ọya kedụzị anụ ọzọ ọ chọrọ ịmata
Ọbụ ụkwụ a ka nnama ga eji ruo Umuahia
O nweghị ihe mgbawa mere ike, ọbụ mma ka achọrọ ya
Nkakwụ na ezo ezo ka udene hapụ ibu ya. Mana udene o kwerela na ọ ga ebu nkakwụ?
Anaghị asị onye bu ozu lọta nnọọ, kama na arụ mere
Nwata tụọ ilu nna ya tụrụ, ya kwụkwaa ụgwọ nna ya ji
Nwata na amaghị mgbe isi na akụ ala, ya lekwaa ka àlà na eme mgbawa
Ofu onye nwe okeọkpa aaaamana ọha nwe olu ya
Azụọrọ nwata egbe ọhụụ, ọ dị ya ka ya zute ndị mmụọ na ụzọ
Mgwere niile makpuru amakpu, onweghi onye ma nke afo na-aru
Agwọ niile dị ogologo mana e nwere eke nwe ọhịa
Agwọ aghaghi imu ihe toro ogologo
Agwọ ofu onye huru na aghoro ya eke
Ewu mmadụ abụọ na enye nri na anwụ na agụụ
Ọ bụrụ ọnụ ka eji aba ọgaranya ịmara na onye ara ga kachasị ụmụ nna ya
Eze nchi fọgodi ofu, ọ ka ga na egwu achara
Ọbụ sọ onye kọrọ ji na egwute ebe
Ọkụkọ sịrị na ya maara akpata ejuna, mana ya ahụghịzị onye ga ejidere ya nkata
Nwata ya na okenye na eso, ma otaghị ose, ọ taa ọjị
Anya mmiri na agba na ọwa ya
Ọbụ ofu alahaji ka anyị na achụrụ ehi
Ihe nwata ruru ogo ya abụghị ụsa
Ike adịghị ọkwụrụ gbaa mgbọrọgwụ, ọdị na àlà esika ike
Mmụọ jere .... ka asịrị na ọga ejekwa ọzọ, ọsị ka ọ nagodi nke o jere eje
Ọbụ ihea ka Ogidi ga emechaa nwee mee nwafor (not sure I wrote this right)
Chi jiri eji ga eforiri efo
Nsị adịghị na afọ ajọ njọ
Nwere ire gị gụọ eze gị ọnụ
Na obodo ndị isi onye ofu anya bụ eze
Nshikọ na echi eze na obere mmiri
Emee nwata ka emere ibe ya, obi adị ya mma
Emegbuna Okeke ka I nwere meta Okafor mma
Ihe eji maa atụ agwọ, ya na agwọ anaghị ahacha
Ebe ọkụ nyụrụ awụsa ọwa
Ebe onye dara ka chi ya kwaturu ya
Kama okwu m kwuru na ọnụ m ga ekote m ịsị, m sị na mụ ekwughịzị
Ibuo mmiri buo mmanya, ịmara nke ka dị arụ
Anaghị ere ọkụkọ ụkwụ jiri na ụlọ
Ahụchabeghị ndị kwụ ọtọ, ọfọzie ndị nọ ala
Agha rie akụ ma ndụ dị
Gbanarị ajọ mmadụ, gbakwuru ajọ mmụọ
Agwọ na ihe o loro atọgbọrọla
Ihe a abụghị ọkụ agba ngada nwere aya
Akwụ na akị bụkwanụ nwanne
Nwata kwọchaa aka o soro ọgaranya rie ihe
M ga anọrọ bem nọpịa mkpụrụ amụ
Mmakwaara na ekpe azụ
Onye ajụrụ ajụ anaghị ajụ onwe ya
Ewu dinara na ala, dinara na akpụkpa ya
I kpara akwụ kpara akwụ onye nwe akwụ eburukwa akwụ ya
Ogbu mma ga ala na mma
E nwere ebe ụwa tọọrọ ute
Akụ fechaa ọ daara awọ
Ọkụkọ ntị ike na anụ ihe na ite ofe
Ijiji na enweghi onye ndumodu na-eso ozu ala n'ili
Agwa ntị ma ọ nụghị, egburu isi, ntị esoro ya
Obere nwa na amụ iri elu, obi sikwaa ya ike
Ọna abụ ayụwa nsị, achịwa ọchị
Kwọọ mmiri mgbe ọ ka nọ na ọba ụkwụ
Sị hapụ ihe niile tara na abalị ka ọ bụrụ anwụnta
Nwata bịara iku nwa, ọ bụrụ na nwa ọ bịara iku anwụọ, ọ lawanụ
Otu ọbụla ọ masịrị mmiri ya zoo, emechaa ọ ga agbachakwa
Ịbụ ọnọnụlọ mara ihe zụrụ na ahịa
Wepụ aka enwe na ofe tupu ọ ghọọ aka mmadụ
Ọbụ nwa mgbeke amaghị akpụ ịsị, ka ọbụna agụba adịghị nkọ
Ọchụụ nwa ọkụkọ nwe ada. Nwa ọkụkọ nwe nwonwo ọsọ
Oji ihe nwata nwelie aka ya elu. Aka jiwe ya o nwetuo ya. Nwata enwerekwa ya
Umunna nwezuo aku ihe adi mma
mmiri mara ugo asaala ya ahu
Eriri maara ngwugwu, ngwugwu maara onye kere ya
Oji onye n'ala ji onwe ya
Choo ewu ojii mgbe chi ka di
Ayukoo maamiri onu, o gbaa ufufu
Ukwu jie agu, mgbada abiara ya ugwo
Obu aka mere azu mgbako
Onye na ejighi ego ona eshi ofe Owere?
Anaghi agba aka, ahu nwata eze
Ookwa onye meruo ala, ala achuwa ya oso
Ọkụkọ nyuo ahu, ala achuwa ya oso.
Egbe bere, ugo bere, nke siri ibe ya ebena, nku kwaa ya
Aka nri kwoo aka ekpe, aka ekpe akwoo aka nri
Mkpa ka mkpa siwe ite, mkpa ka mkpa afotuo ya
Egbuo dike na ogu ulo, eruo na ogu ezi achowa dike
eme elu mee ala, mbo toro eze (come rain come shine nails senior teeth)
gini ka nsi na-acho n'agba
nwata ona egosi nna ya oke ala?
nwata ona ebu nna ya uzo amuta di okpara?
Okuko siri na kama ya ama nchota ihe ona acho na isiakwu kama ka ogwu dupia ya  anya
Egbe siri na ihe o soro uzo tewe aka ihe ya ma ka o buru nwa okuko lota
Ogu nduru anaghi apu mmee
Ejuna siri na ndi mmadu na-eche na ya akaghi ahu, mana emee ha si n'azu bia na ejide ya, o nweghi onye egwu na ekwe si n'ihu bia jide ya
Onye atu gburu nna ya anaghi eji mpi atu anu nkwu. (Atu is buffalo)
Ogwumagana siri na ya agaghi eji maka na oku na agba ozara wee hapu ije ogaranya nna ya kuziri ya
onye na akpu ite adighi mma izu ejuna na ahia
ori ihe guru ya ji akwa okuko nwee gbaworo ehi. Mgbe umunna ya tawara ya uta, o siri na o bu ihe guru ya ka o riri

erisia nri akpogho utaba odi ka eji iwe nwee ri
mgbada taa nri o gbaa oso n'ugwu
ikpe mara eziokwu aka azụ dị na ya

agbisi gbaa otule, otule amụrụ akọ -- interesting how this proverb has a double meaning: the obvious and the hidden. Akọ means wise but kọ is also the root word for ịkọ (to itch/scratch). The proverb means "Experience is the best teacher" on the one hand, and also "na condition make crayfish bend" on the other hand. Like it is the bite of the ant that made the buttocks learn how to itch.
aga eri ọna mana chi ga efo (people don't rush to do unpleasant things)
ndu dị na ntị (there's life in hearing)
kama ehim ga agbanarim,  m gbubiri ya ọdụdụ
ebe nwata kotere ejuna, ona agafe ebe ahu, anya ga adi ya nko (sideways . towards the place. o nwere ike oburuzie agwu maobi akpi nozie ebe ahu)
Ugbabe tubalu udene, udene elibe. (ilu ndi enugwu ezike)
Nwaanyị makarịa di ya n'uzọ, ihe chere di ya, ewere ya
Otu onye siere igwe mmadụ nri, ọha ga-ericha nri ahụ mana igwe mmadụ siere otu onye nri, ọ gaghị erichanwu ya.
literalTranslation: When one person cooks for the public, they finish it. But when the public cooks for an individual, he can't finish it
meaning: One person cannot be stronger than the public

text: Otu aka rụta mmanụ, o jezuo ọha
literalTranslation: When one finger touches oil, it spreads to the rest
meaning: One person's bad behaviour can result to misfortune of his friends/colleagues

text: Onye kpatara nkụ ahụhụ si ngwere bịara ya ọrụ.
literalTranslation: He who brought ant infested firewood is inviting lizard to come work for him
meaning: Every action has consequences

text: Agadi anaghị aka nka n'egwu o ma-agba
literalTranslation: An old woman does not get too old for a music she knows how to dance

text: Ikwo aka tiri ọkụkọ akị
literalTranslation: To wash hands only to crack nuts for the cock
meaning: To engage in a futile endeavour

text: Onye gba bọọlụ, ọ racha oroma
literalTranslation: Only those who played football would eat oranges
meaning: No pain no gain chai odid ewhg jkkam gwa gi ofu ihe doro anya. Anyi niile agaghi adacha mba na ura

text: Onye buru chi ya uzo, o gbagbue onwe ya n'oso
literalTranslation: He who goes ahead of his 'chi', would run to death
meaning: Don't be in excessive haste to achieve

text: Ọkụkọ na-edowe ahụ na ara na-ayị ya ahụbeghị nkịta mmanya na-egbu
literalTranslation: The cock acting mad has not met a drunk dog
meaning: Every obstinate person has someone he fears

text: Aka nri kwọọ aka ekpe, aka ekpe akwọọ aka nri
literalTranslation: When the right hand washes the left, the left reciprocates the gesture
meaning: What goes around comes around

text: Ogologo abụghị na nwam etola
literalTranslation: Growing tall does not mean that my child has grown up
meaning: Maturity is a thing of the mind

text: Agwọ emeghị nke o jiri buru agwọ, ụmụaka a chiri ya hie nkụ
literalTranslation: If a snake does not behave as one, children would use it to tie firewood
meaning: Too much softness causes people to ride on you

text: Ọ bụghị ụbọchi nwata kwafuru mmanu ka a na-apịa ya ụtalị, kama ụbọchị ọ kwafuru mmanụ agbịdị
Ọkwụrụ anaghị akarị onye kụrụ ya
literalTranslation: Okro can never grow too tall for the owner
meaning: A servant/protegee can never surpass his master/mentee

text: Nwata rie ihe ọ na-amụrụ anya, ụra atụọ ya
literalTranslation: When a child eats the food he has been waiting for, he would then sleep
meaning: Often used derogatively to mean: When one attracts the trouble he has been seeking for a long time, he would then become coolheaded

text: A naghị eji ụtụtụ ama njọ ahia
literalTranslation: You don't know a bad sales day from the morning
meaning: Be patient. Don't make rash, hasty judgement

text: Ọgọ bịakarịa , e zie ya kpata nkụ
literalTranslation: When the inlaw visits too often, he will be sent to go fetch firewood
meaning: Over familiarity breeds contempt

text: Okokporo si na ahia ekwoghi ekwo o, umu ya ha di ole n'ahia?
literalTranslation: The young who said that the market was not rowdy enough, how many of his children were there?
meaning: Never criticize the contributions of others when you made no effort yourself

text: Nwanyi lelie di ya, ekwu akpo ya nku
Nwunye awo si na di atoka uto, ya jiri nuta nke ya kworo ya n'azu
literalTranslation: The she-frog said that husband is too sweet, that is why she married hers and carried him on her back
meaning: Cherish what you have

text: Agbogho hokaria di ya aluo eke mmuo
literalTranslation: When a young lady becomes too selective about the kind of man she would marry, she would end up marrying a spirit
meaning: Set realistic expectations. Don't be indicisive

text: A hụ ihe karịrị ubi, ere ọba ji
literalTranslation: When you see something greater than the farm, you sell the barn

text: O re-ere bụ Eze; O zu-azụ bụ eze
literalTranslation: The seller is king. The buyer is also king
meaning: Accord everyone his due respect

text: Ahịa ukwu amaghị na otu onye abiaghi
literalTranslation: A big market does not notice the absence of a single person
meaning: Principle of democracy. The will of the majority overrides the disapproval of an individual

text: Akwukwo juru n'ohia, ma a baa a choba okazi
literalTranslation: The forest is full of vegetables, but when we enter the bush we start looking for the wild spinach
meaning: Value sets one apart

text: Onye ana ekwu nwere ihe ona eme
literalTranslation: He who is most talked about, does something special
meaning: Value sets one apart

text: O nweghị ihe anya hụrụ gba obara
literalTranslation: No sight can make the eyes shed blood
meaning: No situation is totally hopeless

text: Awọ anaghị agba ọsọ ehihie n'efu
literalTranslation: The toad does not run in the day time for nothing
meaning: Unusual occurences are not without an unusual causes

text: Otu mkpụrụ akwụ adịghị efu n'ọkụ
literalTranslation: A lone palm kernel does not get lost in the fire
meaning: People don't get careless with something when it is all they have

text: A na-esi n'ulọ mara mma pụọ ama
literalTranslation: Charity begins at home
meaning: Charity begins at home

text: Ebe a na-adụ nwa nwere nne ọdụ, ka nwa na-enweghị nne na-amụta ihe.
literalTranslation: The orphan learns from the advice being given to a child with parents
meaning: Learn from the experience of others

text: Nne ewu na-ata igụ, ụmụ ya a na-ele ya anya n'ọnụ.
literalTranslation: While the she-goat eats grass, her kids watch her mouth
meaning: People learn more from what we do than what we say

text: Nwata na-ata akara, na-ata ego ya.
literalTranslation: The child eating akara, is eating his money
meaning: Deny present pleasure for future gain

text: Onye njem na-aka onye isi awọ ama ihe
literalTranslation: The traveller is wiser than the grey-haired man
meaning: We learn more by going into the unfamiliar than by spending more time in what we already know. Move beyond your comfort zone

text: Ukpana okpoko gburu bụ nti chiri ya.
literalTranslation: The grasshopper killed by the stork bird was probably deaf
meaning: People who fall into calamity after ignoring danger signs will theirselves to blame

text: Onye mara asụ, sụọ n'odo. Ma ị maghị asụ, sụo n'ala.
literalTranslation: He who knows how to pound, should pound in the mortar. He who doesn't, should pound on the floor
meaning: Used after giving someone advice. Implies: if you are wise, you would know how to apply this advice. If you are foolish, you would only use it foolishly to no effect.

text: Agadi wekọtachaa ọkazị ma gbajie mgbọrọgwụ ya, agụụ biara n'afọ nke mbụ ga-abịakwa ọzọ.
literalTranslation: When the old woman breaks the okazi root after plucking its leaves, then the hunger that visited her the previous year would repeat itself this year
meaning: Learn from experience

text: O nweghị onye na-ajụ ofe azụ juputere na ya.
literalTranslation: Nobody rejects a soup full of fish
meaning: Nobody rejects a good thing

text: Ihe oma na anya bu nwanne
literalTranslation: Good things and the eyes are siblings
meaning: Everybody loves good things

text: Anaghi ahapu ebe ana echi ozo gawa ebe ana aru agwu
literalTranslation: You don't leave a title taking ceremony to attend a ritual
meaning: Nobody chooses suffering over enjoyment

text: Onye si na ya anaghi ata anu nkita, ya arakwala mmiri ofe ya.
literalTranslation: He who does not eat dog meat should not also drink the sauce
meaning: Don't be a hypocrite. Live by your principles

text: Okenye na anaghi ata anu nkita, ekwesighi iji eze ya ekere ya umuntakiri
literalTranslation: The elder who does not eat dog meat should not use his teeth to cut it up for kids
meaning: Don't be a hypocrite. Live by your principles

text: Ura ga-eju onye nwuru anwu afo
literalTranslation: The dead shall be fed up with sleep
meaning: The one in a haste to make a life-altering decision against advice, would have to live with it for a long time

text: Gidi gidi bụ ugwu eze
Otu onye tuo izu, o gbue ochu
literalTranslation: When one person makes a decision by himself, he can kill somebody
meaning: Two heads are better than one

text: Ihe ehi hụrụ gbalaba oso ka okuku huru na-atụ onu
literalTranslation: The thing that the cow saw and ran away, the cock saw it and continued picking for food
meaning: Fools rush where angels fear to thread. Foolishness makes one ignorant of dangers

text: Oge adighi eche mmadu
literalTranslation: Time waits for nobody
meaning: Make judicious use of your time

text: E lewe ukwu Egbue ewu
literalTranslation: Looking at the female backside, one can kill a goat

text: Ihe di woro ogori azuala na ahia
literalTranslation: The 'secret' a husband kept from his wife is now the talk of the market

text: Ewu nwuru n'oba ji abughi agu gburu ya.
literalTranslation: The goat that dies in a yam, was not killed by hunger

text: Onye ma ka mmiri si were baa n'opi ugboguru?
literalTranslation: Who can tell how water entered inside the pumpkin?

text: A chuo aja ma a hughi udele, a mara na ihe mere be ndimmuo.
literalTranslation: When no vultures are seen after a sacrifice, you know that something has happened in the land of the spirits

text: Ugo chara acha adi(ghi) echu echu
literalTranslation: A sparkling eagle does not fade
meaning: Who God has blessed no man can curse

text: Onye ubiam ona aza "Omeokachie"?
literalTranslation: Does a poor man take the title "He who completes whatever he started"?

text: Mbe si na oru oha di mma, mana oriri oha na-aka ahu.
literalTranslation: The tortoise said he likes it when the public comes to help him work, but feeding the public on the other hand, is stressful
meaning: He who loves to be helped, should also love helping others

text: Nwaanyi muta ite ofe mmiri mmiri, di ya amuta ipi utara aka were suru ofe.
literalTranslation: When a woman learns to make watery soup, the husband learns to make a hole in the mould before making soup

text: Ugwu muta igbaji ukwu, agadi nwanyi amuta arikata ezuo ike
literalTranslation: If the hill learns to prove tough climb, the aged woman learns how to rest intermittently while climbing

text: Mbe si na ihe ya ji-achiri ihe egwu ya aga njem bu maka ya izute ndi egwu.
literalTranslation: The tortoise says that why he always travels with his music instruments is because he doesn't know when he would meet fellow musicians

text: O na-abu a si nwata wuba ahu, o saba afo ya.
literalTranslation: When a child is told to bath, he starts bathing his belly
meaning: People can only do what they know about

text: Ukpana gbabara n'ikpo okuko na-ala ala mmuo.
literalTranslation: The grasshopper which runs into the midst of cocks is going to the land of the dead

text: Onye a kporo apari, o na-ehi n'amanna ya, abughi apari.
literalTranslation: A so called worthless man who sleeps in his father's compound (as opposed to the bar or something) is not a worthless man
meaning: It is no small wisdom to always remember your home/family/roots

text: Ndi na-eje mposi abali na-ahu ukpana ndi mmuo.
literalTranslation: Those to go stooling at night (in the bush), do see the grasshopper of the spirits

text: Nwata bunie nna ya enu, akpaamu ya ayochie ya anya.
literalTranslation: When a child lifts up his father off the ground (in a fight), his father's balls would cover his eyes
meaning: Fight your elders to your doom

text: Onye hapu onu ya, uguru arachaa ya.
literalTranslation: If one neglects (to lick) his lips, the harmattan will lick it for him
meaning: Take care of what belongs to you or watch it spoilt

text: Okuko si na ihe ya ji-ele anya n'enu ma ya na añu mmiri bu na ihe na-egbu si n'igwe abia.
literalTranslation: The cock said that why he keeps looking at the sky while drinking water is because the thing that kills always comes from above
meaning: Know your enemy. Don't be naive in face of danger

text: "Nwunye anyi, nwunye anyi": ka ndeeli bia ka anyi mara onye o bu nwunye ya.
literalTranslation: "Our wife, our wife": wait till nightfall and we would know whose wife she is
meaning: Action speaks louder than voice

text: Ura towa uto, ekwowe ya ekwowe.
literalTranslation: When the sleep becomes so sweet, one snores
meaning: When an experience becomes enjoyable, you put even more resources and attention to it

text: O bialu be onye abiagbuna ya, mgbe o ga-ala mkpumkpu apukwana ya n'azu.
literalTranslation: The visitor should not bring misfortune, so that when he leaves he may not develop a hunchback

text: Nwa ovu na-eto, o di ka o ga-aka nne ya.
literalTranslation: When the baby wren is growing, it looks like it would be bigger than its mother

text: Okuko na-arọgọrọ ite onu, chetekwe mma gburu ya.
literalTranslation: The cock twisting its neck in anger at the pot should remember the knife that killed it
meaning: Don't transfer aggression and anger to people who did you no wrong

text: Ihe ka-nte bata n'onu nte, nte etefu.
literalTranslation: When something greater than the pigmy cricket enters its hole, it jumps out
meaning: A major crises forces one out his comfort zone and running up and about for a solution

text: Uzu na-amaghi akpu ogene lee egbe anya n'odu.
literalTranslation: The smith who does not know how to mold a gong should look at the hawk's tail
meaning: You can take clues from similar objects

text: Mmiri anaghi eri onye ona ahughi ukwu ya
literalTranslation: The river can't drown a man who never stepped into it
meaning: The best way to overcome temptation is to avoid it

text: Okwụrụ anaghi amiri ote ofe
literalTranslation: The good cook never gets a good harvest of okro in his farm
meaning: Good opportunities don't come by for those who knows how to utilize them

text: Mmiri riri enyi ka mbe huru na-awa ogodo: o ga-efe mmiri a efe ka o ga-awu ya awu?
literalTranslation: The river that swallowed an elephant is what the tortoise is preparing to go into. Is it going to fly over it or jump across?
meaning: Don't take excessive risks

text: Ohia woro gi nku, sere gi onu
literalTranslation: The bush which denies you firewood, actually stretched your neck
meaning: Every disppointment is a blessing

text: O bia mgbe alio ene gburu atu, ya biakwa ma atu zogbuo alio ene.
literalTranslation: He who calls whenever elder deer kills a buffalo, let him also call when the buffalo stamps an elder Ene to death
meaning: People who encourage weaker people to go violent, should also be there for them when the violence engulfs them

text: O buru na i taa m aru n'ike, ma i zeghi nsi; mu taa gi aru n'isi, agaghi m ezere uburu
literalTranslation: If you bite me at the buttocks without minding faeces; when I bite your head, I wouldn't stir clear of your brain
meaning: If you harm me knowingly. when I revenge, I go for the kill

text: Okuko mmanya na-egbu ahubeghi mmanwulu ara na-ayi.
literalTranslation: A drunk cock has not seen a mad fox
meaning: Every stubborn person has someone he respects and fears

text: Nwanyi anaghi eji na nwunye di ya kwere ya ekene nke oma kpowa ya ogo
literalTranslation: A woman does not start calling her husband's brother's wife an inlaw just because the woman responded to her greeting
meaning: You don't take an enemy as a friend just because he suddenly acts nice

text: Mmiri anaghi agbaru n'isi ya
literalTranslation: A stream does not get stale in its source

text: Echi di ime. Onye ma ihe ọ ga amụ?
literalTranslation: Tomorrow is pregnant. Who knows what it will bear?
meaning: The future is unpredictable

text: Anaghi ekpuchi anwụrụ ọkụ.
literalTranslation: You don't a smoke
meaning: Don't try to hide what can't be hidden

text: Onye mmiri amaghi amagi mmiri nwere okpukpu
literalTranslation: He who has not beaten by the one who does not know that the rain has bones in it
meaning: Experience is the best teacher. People who have not experienced something tend to underestimate it

text: Onye anwụ gbara na atụ ogboro ijiji egwụ.
literalTranslation: He who was bitten by a mosquito dreads the corpse of a housefly
meaning: Bad experience makes people to become paranoid

text: Atụọ dike n’ala, anụ uzu ya.
literalTranslation: When they throw down a warrior (in a fight) he makes a loud sound
meaning: The fall of the mighty makes for big news

text: O were onye etinyere azụ na ọnụ, ya si na ya achọghi?
literalTranslation: Is there anyone who rejects a piece of fish put in his mouth?
meaning: Everybody likes good things

text: Osọndu anaghị agwụ ike.
literalTranslation: People don't get tired when running for their lives
meaning: When struggling for survival, you don't quit

text: Onye ka mmadụ ka chi ya
literalTranslation: He who is greater than someone is also greater than that person's chi (personal god/spirit force)

text: Okoro etoghi eto wara ọgọdọ, ikuku eburuya ma ọgọdọ ya.
literalTranslation: When a young man starts wearing clothes before reaching maturity, the wind carries both him and the cloth
meaning: Take life in steps. Don't do things before the right time

text: Ọnụ ọma ka nwanyi ji anara di ya ihe.
literalTranslation: A good mouth is what a woman uses to get things from her husband
meaning: Soft words attracts favour

text: Ogori nuo di n’abọ ọ mara nke ka mma.
literalTranslation: When a woman marries two husbands, she then realizes the one she prefers
meaning: Experience makes for informed decision

text: E nenie nwaite ọ gbọnyụọ ọku
literalTranslation: When you look down on a small pot it tends to boil over and quench the fire
meaning: Don't look down on nobody

text: Kama mmanya ga esetara enyi na abọ okwu ka ite mmanya a hu, kuwa na ụzọ.
literalTranslation: It is preferable that the wine pot rather break on the way, rather than the wine becoming an object of strife between
meaning: Better a 'good thing' be lost than that it causes division between brothers or friends

text: Oke soro ngwere maa mmiri, mmiri kọọ ngwere ọga akọwa oke?
literalTranslation: The rat joins the lizard to play in the rain. When the lizard dries up shortly afterwards would the rat also dry?
meaning: Don't do things because others are doing same

text: Onye nyere nwa osa akwu ahuru ahu?
literalTranslation: Who gave a squirrel roasted palm fruit?
meaning: Who give a poor man good thing of life?

text: Isi kote ebu, ebu agbaa ya.
literalTranslation: The head that brings home the wisp, would surely be bitten by it
meaning: There are consequences for every action

text: Ubochi ọgụ abụghi ụbọchi ikpe.
literalTranslation: The day of battle is not the day for peace discussions
meaning: There is time for everything. OR Do not handle tense situations with kid gloves

text: Mberede yiri dike, mana ọ bu mberedé ka eji ama dike.
literalTranslation: An unforseen circumstance defies a warrior. Yet warriors are proven by unforseen circumstances
meaning: Strong people are known in tough times

text: Ihe okenye nọ ala hu nwata anaghi ahu ya na enu osisi.
literalTranslation: What an elder sees sitting down, a young child cannot see it even if he climbs a tree
meaning: experience matters

text: Agbanwee dike izu, agbaa ya mgba n’abo.
literalTranslation: A discussion held in the absence of a strong man, would be held a second time
meaning: Some persons are indispensable in some gatherings

text: Onye ga-asi na ofe nne ya adịghị ụtọ?
literalTranslation: Who ever says his mother's soup is not tasty?
meaning: People will always support their own

text: Ewu mmadu abuọ nwe na ehị n’iro
literalTranslation: A goat fed by two persons usually dies of hunger

text: O nweghi ihe ura mere anya
literalTranslation: Sleep causes no damage to the eyes
meaning: A temporal setback does no damage. (We close our eyes when sleeping only to open them again bright and clear afterwards

text: Nwata etoghi eto juwa ihe gburu nnaya, ihe gburu nna ya egbuo ya
literalTranslation: When a child starts probing the cause of his father's death before getting mature enough; then what killed his father would eventually kill him too
meaning: Apply discretion in dangerous matters

text: Ajuru nwata ihe gburu nne ya, o si na obu eju. Ajuo ya ihe gburu nna ya, O si obu eju. Ajuo ya gini ka o ji na aka, o si obu eju. Nwam ndu o na-agukwa gi?
literalTranslation: A child was asked what killed his mother and he said 'snail'. He was asked what killed his father and he said snail. He was asked what he had in his hand, he said snail. My child do you desire to live at all?
meaning: Avoid things which are not good for you

text: ọzụ shiwe ishi, enyi ka nwanne a laa
literalTranslation: When the corpse begins to ooze, 'the friend greater than a brother' would take his leave
meaning: It is only family that will never forsake you

text: Mmiri dooro na eju, dooro nwa nkita
meaning: One's responsibilities always await him

text: Onye ndidi na-ata azu ukpoo
literalTranslation: The patient man eats a big fish

text: Agu bata ohia mgbada awara oso
literalTranslation: When the leopard enters the jungle, the antelope runs for his life
meaning: At the entrance of a powerful man, small problems disappear

text: Aka aja aja na ebute onu mmanu mmanu
literalTranslation: Sandy hands bring about an oily mouth
meaning: No pain no gain

text: Emee ngwa ngwa emehara odachi
literalTranslation: Doing things with speed prevents future catastrophies
meaning: When you handle issues as soon as possible you prevent future catastrophies

text: Oji nwayo anaghi emeru ahu
literalTranslation: He who walks gently doesn't get injured
meaning: Take things easy

text: Ochuu abuo anaghi enweta
literalTranslation: He who chases two things at a time does not get any
meaning: Learn to focus

text: Eze puo, eze anochie
literalTranslation: When a king dies, another replaces him
meaning: Nobody is indispensible

text: Onye kwe chi ya ekwe
literalTranslation: When one says yes, his Chi (spirit/personal god/life force) also affirms
meaning: heaven helps those who help themselves

text: Ihe akiilu na-ada na nti abughi ihe o na ato n’onu
literalTranslation: The way the bitter kola sounds (when chewed) is not the same way it tastes
meaning: All that glitters is not gold

text: Ihe akotara na akuku ite na ala na akuku onu
literalTranslation: What is gotten from the side of the pot ends up in the side of the mouth
meaning: Illgotten wealth is not enjoyed fully

text: Anu bu uzo na-anu mmiri oma
literalTranslation: The earliest animal to the stream drinks fresh water
meaning: It pays to be ahead

text: Anaghi enye oke azu ka odebe
literalTranslation: You don't give fish to a rat for safekeeping
meaning: Don't trust someone with his weakness

text: Anaghi ekpuchi afo ime aka
literalTranslation: You can't cover a pregnancy with your bare hands
meaning: Good things cannot be hidden

text: Onye amuma anaghi enwe ugwu na ala nna ya.
literalTranslation: A prophet has no respect in his home town
meaning: We don't value what we have

text: Uwa na-eme ntughari
literalTranslation: The world rotates
meaning: nothing lasts for ever

text: Ukwa ruo oge ya, o daa
literalTranslation: A breadfruit falls from the tree at its due time
meaning: Desirable things would come by at the appointed time

text: Ochi abughi uto
literalTranslation: laughter does not imply friendship
meaning: Don't be deceived by superficials

text: Uka akpara akpa, isi ka eji ekwe ya
literalTranslation: A thoroughly discussed matter only requires nods of affirmation
meaning: Thorough discussion of an issue helps ensures agreement

text: Obu onye nwe ozu na-ebu ebe isi ya
literalTranslation: It is he who owns the corpse that carries it from the head side

text: Kedu ihe anyi ga-eme nwata na awa akwa anu ara nne ya?
literalTranslation: What shall we do to a child that can wear a cloth but still suckles the mother's breast?
meaning: It is not right for adults to still have childish attitudes

text: I nyuchaa nsi, ekpochighi ya aja, o buru afo osisa
literalTranslation: It is only dysentry that makes one defecate on the ground and not cover it up with sand afterwards
meaning: Do not do things halfway. Do things to completion

text: O ma akwa asa ahu, mara onwe ya.
literalTranslation: He who baths with his clothes should better advice himself
meaning: The evildoer should think twice about his actions

text: Okuko hapu kwomkwom keduzi ihe oga eji zuo umu ya?
literalTranslation: If the mother hen stops clucking, how is she going to feed her chicks

text: Onye fee eze, eze eruo ya aka
literalTranslation: When one reveres the king, he himself gets to become royalty one day
meaning: Give honour to whom it is due

text: Anaghi agwa ochi nti na agha esula
literalTranslation: You don't tell an obstinate man that the war has broken out
meaning: When people don't listen to premonition are damned to face the consequences

text: Nkita nwere ike iju nri, mana ogaghi aju iza oku
literalTranslation: A dog may refuse to eat. But it can't refuse to answer your call first
meaning: Don't let disagreements breach communication

text: Nkita nwere ike amaghi ano odu
literalTranslation: The dog with bountiful buttocks does not know how to sit down
meaning: People who have treasures handed hand to them usually misuse it

text: Onye aghugho lie onwe ya, ofu aka ya ga eseriri n’elu
literalTranslation: When a cunning man dies, a cunning man buries him
meaning: When you want to trick people, you usually get tricked yourself

text: Agwo turu mbe turu okpokoro
literalTranslation: A snake that bites a tortoise (shell), actually bit some inanimate container
meaning: A weak man can withstand more deadly foes is he well protected

text: Anya bewe, imi esoro ya
literalTranslation: When the eyes starts crying, the nose follows suit
meaning: It is good to moan with others

text: Anaghi eji ihe ana agba na nti agba na anya
literalTranslation: You don't wear an earring on your eyes
meaning: Don't play with precious things

text: Ire oma ka ejuna ji aga n’ogwu
literalTranslation: A good tongue is what enables the snail to thread on thorns. (The snail's body looks like a tongue). A soft, slippery body is what enables the snail to walk on thorns
meaning: Soft words calm tense situations

text: Ofo ka ide ji awa ala
literalTranslation: Uprightness/Purity of heart is the weapon with which the flood digs gullies
meaning: A pure heart can overcome seeming rocklike obstacles

text: Ahu ekwughi mere okenye. Ekwuo ma anughi mere nwata
literalTranslation: Seeing without saying the elder's bane. Speaking without listening is the child's bane
meaning: Virtue lies in the middle

text: Oke amakwana ụma taa akpa dibia. Dibia amakwana ụma buwe oke onu
literalTranslation: The rat should not maliciously chew the native doctor's bag. The native doctor should not maliciously starve the rat
meaning: Give everyone his due

text: Ekweekwe na-ekwe na ute ekwere.
literalTranslation: The obstinate person will finally become obedient on the burial mat
meaning: Don't be too headstrong

text: Aruru siri na o maara ka o ga adi ya na udi mmiri, o nwee jiri okochi kpaa nri
literalTranslation: The ant said he knows how tough it will be during rainy season. That is why it used the dry season to gather food
meaning: Plan for the rainy day

text: Onye amamihe na Aba bu onye apari na Abba
literalTranslation: A wise man in Aba (a town) becomes a foolish man in Abba (another town)
meaning: No one knows it all

text: Agha akpara akpa anaghi eri ngworo
literalTranslation: A cripple does not die in a pre-announced war
meaning: To be forewarned is to be forearmed

text: Si hapu isi nkwu na ure nkwu, si nukene ihe nkwu gbatara
literalTranslation: forget the smell and soured look of the palm wine and drink it first before judging
meaning: Don't judge a book by its cover

text: Oche ka o rie nne di awo
literalTranslation: He who waits till he has much before he can give is stingy
meaning: You can help people from the little you have

text: Ihe rachara ofe eburukwuola utara
literalTranslation: What licked the soup has also carried the pounded yam
meaning: Things have gotten out of hand

text: Ihe riri oba erikwuola ihe di oba n’ime
literalTranslation: what ate the barn has also eaten the contents in the barn
meaning: Things have gotten out of hand

text: Oburu na mu agbaghi mmiri agam agbariri obara
meaning: I will give all it takes

text: Anam anwuanwu ezutela anam anwuwanyu anya
Echewe ka esi n’imi rahu ura chi ga efo

literalTranslation: A newly married wife sweeps even a closed path
meaning: People show their best behaviour at the beginning of relationships
text: Alụọ nwanyi ọhụụ, ọ zaa ámá chiri echi

meaning: Everyone has a valid reason why they cannot do what they desire to do
literalTranslation: The tortoise said he desires to be a teacher, only that his hands are too short to reach the blackboard
text: Mbekwu sịrị na nkụzi na agụ ya mana aka ya agaghị eruzi na ebe edemede
Akpaa akpaa arahụ n'ute
literalTranslation: When proper dialogue is done, they can sleep on the mat
meaning: dialogue makes for peaceful co-existence

text: Ka ana aga n'ubi, ka ji na aka
literalTranslation: Let's keep going to the farm, and let the yam keep getting stronger
meaning: keep on keeping on

text: achuwa ehi zogbuo mmadu, ahapugodi ehi
literalTranslation: While chasing after a cow, if a man dies of stampede, then the cow is left alone for the moment
meaning: Some things are more important than others. Weightier matters command attention

text: Otu aka anaghi eke ngwungwu
literalTranslation: One hand does not tie a parcel
meaning: We all need a good support system

text: Anaghi ahapu isiaka jee gwawa uriom
meaning: You don't leave what is important to indulge less important tasks

text: Atuolu omalu, omalu. Atuolu ofeke, ofenye ishi na ohia
literalTranslation: When you advice the wise, he learns. When you advice the foolish, he runs headwards into the bush
meaning: A wise person learns from advice, a foolish person gets worse after being advised

text: Ogbonna abughi nna
literalTranslation: "Father's name sake" is not the same thing as the father
meaning: Appearance and reality are not one and the same

text: Onye ji igu ka ewu na eso
literalTranslation: It is he who has the palm fronds that the goat follows
meaning: Have what people want, and they will run after you, He who pays the piper dictates the tune

text: Sooso ihe ana amaghi ka esi eme ya bu onwu
literalTranslation: It is only death that has no solution
meaning: Once there is life, there is still hope

text: Ikwu amaghi, ibe ezi ya
literalTranslation: What a relation does not know, a mate shows him

text: Oji ofo ga ana
literalTranslation: He who has the ofo (symbol of uprightness) shall go scot free
meaning: He righteous shall always triumph over any evil situation
